question_sentence: Trump’s second impeachment trial began this week. House Democratic impeachment managers promised to present new evidence and _______.
Which celeb surprised fans and announced she will release new music again after releasing two full albums in the last seven months?
According to the CDC, wearing a tight-fitting mask or a double mask can dramatically decrease exposure to and spread of COVID-19.
Which founding member of The Supremes died this week at the age of 76?
Tessica Brown found herself in a sticky situation when she used Gorilla Glue on her hair after running out of _________.
Roughly ___ percent of the USA’s coronavirus deaths could have been prevented, a new study shows.
Which professional sports league says teams must play the national anthem before games “in keeping with longstanding league policy”?
We've all heard about the Zoom cat lawyer, but can you recall what he was in the courtroom for that day?
choices: A case regarding COVID-19 social distancing violations
An arraignment for an accused counterfeit art dealer
A case involving a man exiting the U.S. with contraband
A case involving a man entering the U.S. with contraband

question_sentence: Tina Turner is one of 16 artists up for induction into the Rock Hall this year.
President Joe Biden announced completion of a deal to purchase how many vaccine doses?
The Queen reportedly lobbied for a law change in the 1970s to hide her private wealth after learning of the proposed transparency legislation through an arcane parliamentary procedure known as what?
Up to how many UK-based academics are reportedly being investigated over allegations that they unwittingly handed national security secrets to China?
Boris Johnson has appointed ex-Labour MP John Woodcock to investigate ‘far-left infiltration’ of which two protest groups?
choices: Society for the Protection of Unborn Children and the National Secular Society
Fathers4Justice and the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament
Black Lives Matter and Extinction Rebellion

question_sentence: Which magazine this week launched a legal action to publish Alex Salmond’s evidence to the inquiry into the Scottish government’s handling of harassment claims against him?
Politicians from which country have been booted out of luxury hotels after racking up massive unpaid bills during ongoing peace talks?
Allies of Germany have turned on Berlin for supporting a controversial Russian pipeline project known as what?
Plans to build the UK’s first new coal mine in 30 years have been thrown into doubt by which council’s decision to review the planning permission following a public outcry?
Elon Musk sent bitcoin prices soaring this week by revealing that his car firm Tesla has invested how much in the cryptocurrency?
Towns in what European country have made headlines for banning the use of face masks despite high Covid case rates and a faltering vaccine rollout?
What company this week announced it is conducting a feasibility study in China about flying cars?
Reports have surfaced about former President Donald Trump’s battle with Covid in October. The situation allegedly got so serious doctors considered, but ultimately decided against, what treatment?
choices: giving a new mix of supplemental oxygen
flying him to a private hospital
evidence: According to sources first reported in the New York Times, Trump’s blood oxygen levels were so low that doctors debated putting him on a ventilator while at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, suggesting his condition was much worse than publicly known at the time.

question_sentence: The US is sending B-1 bombers for the first time to Norway, a show of force meant to deter aggression from which country in the region?
evidence: In an effort to deter Russia, B-1 bombers and 200 personnel from Dyess Air Force in Texas are being deployed to Orland Air Base in Norway. Defense officials say that missions will begin over the next three weeks in the Arctic Circle and in international airspace off northwestern Russia.

question_sentence: Prosecutors in which US state are opening a criminal investigation into former President Donald Trump’s alleged pressuring of state officials to “find” votes in order to overturn Joe Biden’s certified victory?
evidence: Prosecutors in Fulton County, Georgia have asked state officials to preserve documents related to Trump’s phone call last month with Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger in which the former president urged him to “find” the votes needed to overturn the results. This comes amid Trump’s second impeachment trial and other legal action being taken in New York.

question_sentence: According to new CDC guidance, this practice is quite effective at protecting against Covid-19.
evidence: The CDC released guidance that double masking, if done properly, is effective in blocking 92% of potentially infectious viral particles from escaping.

question_sentence: Over one hundred people are missing and dozens are dead after an avalanche tore through a dam in northern India. What caused the avalanche?
choices: a piece of glacier breaking off
evidence: The incident occurred in the Himalayas in Uttarakhand, a state in northern India, after a massive piece of glacier broke off. Rescue efforts are still underway.

question_sentence: The Biden administration officially announced sanctions against what country, which was recently rocked by a military coup?
evidence: Biden is demanding the release of Myanmar’s de facto leader Aung San Suu Kyi who had been taken prisoner along with other high-ranking government members. The coup the country’s November election. Mass protests are ongoing.

question_sentence: Women’s rights activist Loujain al-Hathlou was released from prison this week after being detained in 2018. Where was she being held?
evidence: Hathlou was released from prison in Saudi Arabia. The activist received international attention after being arrested in 2018 as part of the government’s broad sweep to detain figures protesting against the government and its ban on women driving.

question_sentence: In an apparent tit-for-tat move, China is banning which global news organization from operating in the country?
evidence: China is banning BBC World News, one week after British media regulators withdrew the license for China Global Television Network to broadcast in the UK.

question_sentence: Which celebrity’s stunt double is feeling the pain trying to keep up with the star’s muscular bulking routine?
evidence: Bobby Holland Hanton is working to maintain his bulk as the stunt double to Chris Hemsworth while working on the latest Thor film, “Thor: Love and Thunder.” According to Holland, it’s “the biggest Thor he’s ever been.”

question_sentence: “Aunt Jemima” products are getting a rebrand. What will they now be called?
evidence: According to parent company PepsiCo, the Aunt Jemima brand is set to be replaced by the name Pearl Milling Company. Aunt Jemima, along with a number of other brands from various companies, are being phased out because of their racist undertones.
